website_summaries.verdict: The Moto X Play's blend of everything you'd expect from a higher-end smartphone with a customisable waterproof design and a great price makes it a superb midrange phone.
pros: The Motorola Moto X Play packs a great screen and camera
You can customise the look to suit your tastes and it won't conk out the first time you spill your beer on it
cons: It lacks the luxurious wood and leather back cover options of the pricier Moto X Style

customer_reviews.title: Be advised, it's not the version described, purchased the XT1562 and got the XT1564
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when I received the phone, but then I got an unpleasant surprise... It was the wrong version, the product is advertised as the XT1562 but got the XT1564 model... I was like "what is this model? I've never read about this one", so I googled "Moto XT1564 Play" and clicked the third link. It explains that this model (XT1564) is the same as the XT1565 model, aka Droid Maxx 2. Yes, I got the bloatware verizon-free version of the Droid Maxx 2... So the product is not the one as described in this page, PLEASE CORRECT THIS. I'll keep the phone because it's a good phone.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Camera
customer_reviews.text: Phone is slow even from fresh out of the box. Although the quality CAN be great often times the camera will take waaaaay to long to actually take the picture you're trying to take. Also in burst shot, the phone will not often than not freeze and cause some of the photos to be pixelated with colors that shouldn't be there and the bottom half of some of the pictures will be totally black. If I'm barely using the phone the battery will last most of the day but it really only lasts about 2 hours of continuous use.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni M.

customer_reviews.title: Phone went nuts and died.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly didn't expect it to happen, but it did. Phone lasted about 4 months. All of a sudden the screen began going nuts while in the middle of an important call and I had no control over it at all. After the phone did this a couple of times I took it to a dealer and they checked it out and said that the electronics and screen were fried. Had to purchase another phone immediately as I have elders that depend on my being available 24/7. Nice phone while it worked. D. Martin
customer_reviews.author: DGGMDesigns

customer_reviews.title: Winner for overseas use!
customer_reviews.text: bought this unlocked phone to use overseas. It has dual micro sim slots. works great overseas. And use it in the US for wi-fi and WhatsApp communications. I have had several Android phones for overseas use. This one is the best so far. BTW, the camera is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: kurt flowers

customer_reviews.title: Good producttttt
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera. 4g LTE works on T-Mobile :) battery life lasts all day without even charging once. And I use it a lot.

customer_reviews.title: Firmware / Software issues
customer_reviews.text: No matter how many times I downloaded recommended firmware upgrades, It kept suggesting more firmware upgrades. If that wasn't annoying enough, The language describing the proposed upgrade was in Spanish

customer_reviews.text: This Motorola phone is an excellent cellular, but I don't like the Android sistem. I prefer Black Berry sistem!!
customer_reviews.author: Leon Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Nice Phone, limited ringtones
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about this phone but the ringtones were limited and there was no option to add more ringtones. I need that because I have a difficult time hearing the phone ring. Having said that, sadly, I needed to exchange for something else. Otherwise, it is a great phone! Feels very solid and for the price is a good product!
customer_reviews.author: Tom DotCom

customer_reviews.title: This phone is not 4G LTE compatible and only comes with one SIM slot.
customer_reviews.text: The phone is advertised as dual-sim and 4G LTE. Yet the second SIM slot is blanketed off. So is it a Dual-SIM here in the US or am I missing something? Also, This phone only connects to 3G AT&T network. I called AT&T support thinking they need to update the IMEI. We did some troubleshooting on the phone by changing the APN then they tried updating the IMEI on their side with no luck. They see that the phone is only connecting to 3G. Talk about false advertising. Bummer....
customer_reviews.author: YB

customer_reviews.title: not compatible with Verizon.
customer_reviews.text: Phone looked ok. had a very sharp screen. Unfortunately, even though it was unlocked it was not compatible with Verizon. It also came with only Spanish instructions, though English versions are easy to find online. It also only had one Sim card slot...
customer_reviews.author: K R

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Charger included
customer_reviews.text: Phone is fine, but it came with charger made for European outlets and not US outlets. Hard to charge a phone that way!

customer_reviews.title: Too many listings for this phone model
customer_reviews.text: Amazon listings need to be better sorted. I was reading on the phone I wanted and clicked off to look at another. Thought I clicked the right phone and it was the wrong network.
